A timeless classic, a phenomenon game, an INSANE experience. I guess the first two complaints may lead to some negative thoughts (skill issue, which I would say it's 50-50) but the last one is true.
Still totally recommend it even in 2025.

(Game #14 of my 2025 100% Marathon.)
This was the second game of my 2025 list that gave me a feeling of phantom nostalgia, and one of the games that I fully believe deserves all of the praise heaped at its feet. FC3 stands a triumph of ludonarrative cohesion, telling a story of one man's descent into insanity and loss of himself at the hands of an island that seeks to exploit anyone who finds themselves there. The story and characters are engrossing, bolstered by rock-solid gameplay and a tight mission structure. My only gripes are with some of the visual quirks that come with many early 2010s games, such as over-tuned screen-space ambient occlusion (dark halos around objects), and Bloom (with a capital B) that oftentimes blows out the white values in the sky. Some mods are available to address some of the outdated visuals and I suggest you give them a look. The 100% grind for this game is not reflected in Steam achievements, so if you are only achievement hunting, you will wind up doing roughly 75% of the content, with the rest being samey assassination or hunting missions, and hunting for relics.

When situatioms get busy there can be a drop in frame-rate but it didn't last long enough or personally bother me enough to bother changing the settings.

BUT - if you are the type of gamer who likes to roll credits on the games you play, then play a different version of this game. In the final mission "betting against the house" the difficulty gets ramped upto beyond nightmare difficulty. This is not a skill issue, its a known bug. Even when dropping the difficulty to the easiest, you hit a section where you get bombarded by missiles and you can not possibly see where they are coming from or prevent it. Tried for over an hour on this mission that should be a cakewalk by this stage. It is definitely a game breaking bug.
After googling the issue to see others met the same fate on this mission and only a handful of people persevered long enough for the bug to "fix itself" after restarting multiple times, I just cannot recommend playing FC3 on steam.
